definitions.example: Can you work out 250 × 12 in your head for me?
I can't work these instructions out.
This is a beta version; we're still working out the kinks.

definitions.definition: To conclude with the correct solution.
definitions.example: These figures just don't work out.

definitions.definition: To succeed; to result in a satisfactory situation.
definitions.example: Are you still seeing John? – No, it didn't work out.
John won't be here for a while because he is working out.

definitions.definition: To habitually exercise rigorously, especially by lifting weights, in order to increase strength or muscle mass or maintain fitness.
definitions.example: Wow, you're looking good! Do you work out?

definitions.definition: To earn a wage working away from one's farm.
